column4: while restarting it said "Stopping RAID monitoring services....failed!"
wtf.
oh phew.
*sigh* Why is anything other than Windows so hard to install? :\
About the only thing I liked about Vista...it installs pretty much without a glitch.
Hell no! I installed OSX86, was a pain.
Vista? You have a partition...fine, it'll do EVERYTHING else for you.
I've been trying for an hour, and it keeps giving me errors after errors...thats the problem with installing Linux.
Naw dude, you only get blue screens and the likes with old unsupported hardware.
My laptop's beyond fully supported.
what is the hardware you are trying to install on, and is there another operating system on it?
Yep, Windows XP and Vista. It's a Dell Inspiron 9400.
how big of a hard disk?

the problem with Vista (which I doubt you know) is that overtakes your mbr in such a way, that its a hassle to install anything else on it (even Windows -- unless you format the disk). So, for you, I suggest doing a manual partition, using the now-vacant free space of Vista.
Thats what im planning to do. Using the vacant space now to install Ubuntu. It kept giving me errors earlier, im gonna try again now.
the one called boot:
if you bother to read that screen, it will tell you that if you press any key, the timer is disabled :)
don't feel the trolls, please.
its linux not Linux
are you using the alternate cd?
RedGhost take it to #ubuntu-offtopic
